TopicTitle: Boex Inc. Solar and Interstellar Challenges -

Articles.Content:
Boex Inc. proposes two challenges, to develop our knowledge of the the Sun we call Kerbol and the other stars in this Universe.

1) Lowest Altitude Solar Orbit -

The sheer amount of Delta-V required to orbit the sun makes it near impossible to orbit any lower than 5 million Kilometers, so I challenge any worthy Kerbanaut to take up this challenge, and blow my mind. The Apoapsis will be measured, not the Periapsis.

I am yet to attempt this challenge, so go ahead, set the bar.

2) Shortest MET to Kerbol (Sun) Escape -

By this, I mean the time it takes for the snazzy new Patched Conics to say that you will never return to this Solar System. Here\'s my attempt, coming in at 8 minutes and 43 seconds.

Beat me. I dare you.

http://imgur.com/a/MZqyn

Just to get a few things straight, the other escape trajectory is Interstellar I. This is interstellar II.

As a general rule, parts must be 100% stock and no Autopilots either...I think I forgot to mention that earlier, too. HERP. TO. THE. DERP.

Right I did the sundive challenge. It\'s been done a few times before, but hell, bit of repetition never did hurt anyone.

I misread your 5 million KILOmeters and figured you meant just 5 million meters so I did that. Here\'s the craft, humbly named \'DeeVee\'. It\'s currently on a 5 million meter periapsis solar trajectory. I\'ve never tested that burn-up thing that was added this update but I think it\'ll kick in.. The craft still has half a tank (estimate at just under 1km/s dV) left so it might escape..

Apart from MechJeb (which isn\'t really needed, it\'s not a complex flight) it\'s all stock. I did use some tank toggling to regulate flow as the pipe logic turned out to be suboptimal.

Cheers
Don, I think he meant a circular orbit. Eventually there is a point where you\'re too close that you either spiral in, or you spiral out.

Right.. I\'ll have to see if the ship survives this close and if it can do that

I think it could do a circular 5,000,000,000m orbit with the requisite dV

Don, I think he meant a circular orbit. Eventually there is a point where you\'re too close that you either spiral in, or you spiral out.

Correct. Like a fool I forgot to say that the apoapsis would be the dependant variable (Teh 1 U measure ). Sorry about that...

Ok I tried to re-do the mission, problem is that when down at the 5000km altitude the space kraken is in full force, making it very hard to perform appropriate burns. I submit the DeeVee II craft, this craft has more than enough dV (aptly named, eh?) to establish a very low kerbol orbit, I just lack the patience to defeat the kraken and actually do it.
Couldn\'t #2 be described as 'Fastest time to Kerbol Escape Orbit'?
They would be near enough the same, excepting really, really big rockets that burned past the moment of kerbin SoI departure.
Whilst trying to emulate the orbit of Mercury, I managed a 5200000000X5200000000 orbit, and just made it.

Well, the first challenge is confounded a bit by the fuel bug.

As for the second challenge... Pic attached. Actual MET to escape is slightly less, since I had to switch to map view to check, before taking the screenshot. ???
